newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: China notches up another Venezuelan oil contract.
newsitem.headline: China notches up another Venezuelan oil contract.

text.p: China's National Petroleum Corp notched up a second Venezuelan oil contract on Wednesday and expected to join in more investment in the country in the future, a company official said on Wednesday.

CNPC would continue bidding for fields in Venezuela's third round of operating agreements, but Shaoxian declined to say how much more cash would go on the table: "According to the final tender protocol, China's company has the chance to win five areas," she said.
CNPC has spent $358 million just to obtain two 20-year contracts from Venezuela's state-owned Petroleos de Venezuela, and will require much more investments to increase production.
Shaoxian said CNPC now had one operating contract offshore in western Venezuela, one on land in western Venezuela and a feasibility study in Venezuela's bitumen-based boiler fuel orimulsion.
"In the faja maybe we have more opportunity," she said, referring to a possible joint-venture to exploit the vast bitumen deposits in the Orinoco Oil Belt, known as the "faja".
Nelson Vasquez, CNPC's assessor in Venezuela, said he expected to pump 50-60,000 barrels per day (bpd) from Caracoles which was currently producing 5,000-6,000 bpd.
The area contained about 160 million barrels of proven reserves, but it had a "very big exploration potential", Shaoxian said.
CNPC beat Argentina's Perez Companc to the Caracoles contract by only $18 million, while in its bid for the Intercampo field on Tuesday, it offered more than twice its nearest competitor.
